title: Julien Baker Cancels Joint Tour with Torres, Citing Health Reasons
description: The duo, who shared their collaborative country LP Send a Prayer My Way last month, were next scheduled to perform this evening, May 4, at San Antonio’s Stable Hall
author: Walden Green
excerpt: The duo, who shared their collaborative country LP Send a Prayer My Way last month, were next scheduled to perform this evening, May 4, at San Antonio’s Stable Hall
text: The duo, who shared their collaborative country LP Send a Prayer My Way last month, were next scheduled to perform this evening, May 4, at San Antonio’s Stable HallJulien Baker and Torres, March 2025 (Griffin Lotz/Rolling Stone via Getty Images)Julien Baker has canceled the remainder of her joint U.S. tour with Torres. “Due to recent events, Julien Baker is prioritizing her well-being and taking time to focus on her health,” reads a statement posted to the singer’s Instagram. Scroll down to see the message in full.Baker and Torres shared their collaborative country LP Send a Prayer My Way last month. The record featured the singles “Sylvia” and “Sugar in the Tank,” which they debuted on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon. Today’s news follows the cancellations of two previous shows due to an undisclosed band member’s concussion. The duo were next scheduled to perform this evening (Sunday, May 4) at San Antonio’s Stable Hall.Revisit our review of Torres’ 2024 solo album What an Enormous Room and the interview “Julien Baker on Being Queer, Southern, Christian, and Proud.”Walden Green is a music writer and cultural critic who joined Pitchfork in 2024. html:
The duo, who shared their collaborative country LP Send a Prayer My Way last month, were next scheduled to perform this evening, May 4, at San Antonio’s Stable Hall

Julien Baker has canceled the remainder of her joint U.S. tour with Torres. “Due to recent events, Julien Baker is prioritizing her well-being and taking time to focus on her health,” reads a statement posted to the singer’s Instagram. Scroll down to see the message in full.

Baker and Torres shared their collaborative country LP Send a Prayer My Way last month. The record featured the singles “Sylvia” and “Sugar in the Tank,” which they debuted on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon. Today’s news follows the cancellations of two previous shows due to an undisclosed band member’s concussion. The duo were next scheduled to perform this evening (Sunday, May 4) at San Antonio’s Stable Hall.

Revisit our review of Torres’ 2024 solo album What an Enormous Room and the interview “Julien Baker on Being Queer, Southern, Christian, and Proud.”

Walden Green is a music writer and cultural critic who joined Pitchfork in 2024. A graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, his work has appeared in Dirt, The Fader, and Philadelphia. He lives in New York. ... Read more
